Stock is expensive with soft fundies so consider getting out of this before the big hurt at the top of the hour.

Overreaction. 70% of revenue and 64% operating Income come from the Americas. Only 25% revenue and 22% Operating income come from International and most of that is from Japan, Asia Pacific, Europe, Middle East, and Africa, not China. It's estimated only 10% of sales and and 15% operating income of the overall international revenue and operating income are from China. Not even half of the 1300 new international stores opening this year are in China. Yes, Starbucks has Chinese exposure, but not as much as most think. Not enough to justify the current SP action, imo. This kind of overreaction makes me consider opening a position.

I think the Bashers here are smoking Meth. Are we talking about the same Starbucks? Long lines regardless of Covid status, anytime time of day its busy. If I pull up to the drive in with less than 3 cars waiting I thank the Lord! This is a strong growing retail company period. Not just a service company selling coffee and doughnuts. If this stock goes down it will be for one reason; A general market correction. Now if that happens, then everyone gets it in the shorts. Personally, until the senate passes a tax (increment) increase on capital gains, the markets going to continue its ups and downs. I'll keep my money on the Green Lady. BTW the hot mocha's are awesome with non fat milk and calorie saving request of "Hold the Whip Cream please!"
is sbux a buy?

I sure do see a lot of personal opinions and biases here regarding SBUX coffee. Bottom line, it doesn't matter what your personal preferences are, whether you like or dislike. The fact remains, SBUX is the most popular coffee chain in the world. It makes a ton of money, has the highest brand recognition, pricing control, adapted to overcome the pandemic, and is expanding globally. It will soon overtake McDonalds as the largest global restaurant chain. This stock will do very well long term regardless.
